column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
IUCN Red List species and national conversation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations

column7: Dexus' scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 12,346 tCO2e.
Dexus' scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 87,614 tCO2e.
Dexus' scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 28,046 tCO2e.

column13: Dexus is a signatory to RE100 and has been purchasing renewable electricity in the form of GreenPower since 2008, in line with its targets for sourcing 100% renewable electricity and achieving net-zero emissions. Sourcing renewable energy through on-site renewable energy installations and purchasing off-site renewable energy sources is embedded as a standard within Dexus' energy tendering process.
column20: GreenPower, renewable electricity, net-zero emission

column13: Macarthur Wind Farm spans 5,500 hectares and is the largest wind farm in the southern hemisphere. The wind farm comprises 140 wind turbines capable of generating 420 MW of energy, enough to power the equivalent of 180,000 Australian homes every year. Energy generated from the wind farm is fully committed under a fixed-price contract until 2038.
column20: Macarthur Wind Farm, wind turbine, fixed-price contract

column13: Dexus continues to seek opportunities to increase renewable energy generation. This year, Dexus expanded its rooftop solar program across industrial properties to support customers to increase their renewable energy uptake and lower their carbon emissions. The Horizon 3023 Estate at Ravenhall in Victoria is a leading example of this partnership, where Dexus has worked with Scalzo, Amazon, Nike and HelloFresh to deploy over 4.43MW. 31% of the group's industrial portfolio has rooftop solar PV.
column20: Rooftop solar program, renewable energy generation, carbon emission

column13: Dexus completed its first major electrification project at GP Plus Healthcare Centre in Adelaide, which undertook a retrofit of its gas-powered air conditioning system with all-electric air conditioning units in combination with a rooftop solar array. The new, all-electric air conditioning will eliminate the release of direct greenhouse gas emissions. It will improve the system's reliability, while solar provides the added benefit of powering it from cost-effective, renewable electricity generated on-site.
column20: Electrification project, air conditioning unit, greenhouse gas

column13: For incoming assets to the platform, Dexus' AMP Capital established renewable electricity supply agreements (for its east coast assets) with CS Energy in Queensland, Red Energy in NSW/ACT and SmartestEnergy in Victoria, which sees them transition to 100% clean energy from January 2023. The new agreements cover 20 major real estate assets managed by AMP Capital when the agreements were finalised in late 2022. These new supply contracts establish a long-term renewable energy offtake arrangement at preferential rates compared to the current market. It was achieved by leveraging the portfolio size and well-timed market engagement.\t
column20: Renewable electricity supply agreement, clean energy, renewable energy offtake arrangement

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
column7: Dexus generated 24.5 tonnes of NOx emissions in 2023.

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: Dexus's ongoing partnership with Planet Ark gives its customers access to several opt-in programs to support their recycling initiatives, such as Batteries 4 Planet Ark and BusinessRecycling Planet Ark. This year, Dexus promoted their Seedling Bank and National Tree Day to amplify their message.
column20: Planet Ark, recycling, National Tree Day

column13: Every December, in the lead-up to Christmas, Dexus supports Foodbank, which works with front-line charities to feed vulnerable Australians. Non-perishable goods and donations are collected, with customers and staff donating over 870kgs of non-perishable items and raising over $6,600 in monetary donations.
column20: Foodbank, charity, donation

column7: Dexus generated 13,124 tonnes of waste in 2023.
Dexus recycled 5,109 tonnes of waste in 2023.
Dexus directed 8,015 tonnes of waste to landfill in 2023.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column13: Dexus partnered with EcoVadis this year to deploy its global supplier sustainability ratings methodology across its preferred suppliers. EcoVadis enables Dexus to proactively identify risks and opportunities within its supply chain via evidenced-based supplier scorecards.
column20: EcoVadis, supplier sustainability rating, supplier scorecard

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column13: Dexus invested in fault detection analytics to optimise building operations daily, and this approach is also well established across the incoming AMP Capital assets. Dexus is preparing to embed analytics and data-driven maintenance further within upcoming mechanical works, which a new, centralised approach will support. It will standardise, simplify, and reduce the cost of building metrics together and position Dexus at the centre of Dexus' building data ecosystem.
column20: Fault detection analytics, data-driven maintenance, data ecosystem

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: Flexibility at Dexus allows every employee to have a say in when, how, or where their work is performed. Dexus supports and encourages flexible work practices to increase personal well-being and employee engagement, improve team performance and motivation, maximise productivity, retain talent, and encourage an organisational culture of diversity and inclusion.
column20: Flexibility at Dexus, flexible work, employee engagement

column13: Dexus continues to support its employees with young families and other caring responsibilities. Just under half of Dexus' people are parents or guardians of a child aged between 0 and 17 or act as a carer for someone. Dexus' parental leave policy entitlements support families by providing inclusive parental leave assistance for employees.
column20: Parental leave policy, parent, guardian

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column13: As a part of the employment value proposition, Dexus' people are offered the opportunity to have an ownership interest in Dexus and, in doing so, promote a tangible link between the interests of employees, Dexus and its investors. All eligible employees are allocated several DXS securities with an aggregate equivalent cash value of $1,000 annually.
column20: Ownership interest, employee value proposition, DXS security

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column8: Occupational Health and Safety Management System.
column13: Dexus applies comprehensive work health and safety programs and enforces compliance requirements by site contractors and employees following Dexus's ISO 45001 certified Occupational Health and Safety Management System.
column20: Occupational Health and Safety Management System, health and safety program, ISO 45001

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Dexus maintains a business continuity management framework to mitigate safety threats, including adopting plans relating to crisis management, business continuity and emergency management. Responsiveness at each Dexus-managed property is regularly tested through scenario exercises. Key performance indicators for reporting and resolving security issues are embedded into contractor agreements at Dexus-managed assets.
column20: Business continuity management, crisis management, scenario exercise

column13: Dexus' comprehensive workplace health and safety program was re-certified this year under ISO 45001:2018, confirming its continued and comprehensive health and safety monitoring for its employees and workplaces. Dexus also engaged external consultants KPMG to conduct an internal audit of its well-being practices, with action items to be rolled out during FY24.
column20: Workplace health and safety program, health and safety monitoring, internal audit

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: Every quarter at all-staff town hall events, Dexus celebrates safe work practices with its Safety Awards. An example of the recognition awarded this year includes the exceptional response to a code blue medical emergency by Dexus' Willows Shopping Centre management team and a partnership established with Mates in Construction, delivering suicide awareness training sessions at multiple industrial development sites.
column20: Safety Award, code blue medical emergency, suicide awareness

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column8: Work, Health, Safety & Environment training programs
column13: During the year, comprehensive Work, Health, Safety, & Environment training programs were diligently delivered across all departments, ensuring Dexus' workforce remains equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to maintain a safe and good work environment. Dexus believes investing in Work, Health, Safety, & Environment training is essential in fostering a culture of safety and operational excellence.
column20: Work, Health, Safety & Environment training programs, good work environment, culture of safety

column13: Dexus' Safe & Well program supports people's mental, physical, financial and work well-being. Safe & Well provides a breadth of resources designed to help Dexus' people develop and maintain a healthy level of well-being.
column20: Safe & Well program, work well-being, mental well-being

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Dexus' hybrid working model is driven by work requirements, empowering its people to make decisions about work time and location. Dexus' engagement survey results reported that 92% of employees agreed that their manager supported flexible working, and 83% of employees stated that they had found effective ways to collaborate while working flexibly.
column20: Hybrid working model, engagement survey, flexible working

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column13: Throughout the year, Dexus uses its on-site Contractor Work Health Safety sign-in system to engage directly with its suppliers' employees who attend Dexus properties. The integration with the sign-in system helped Dexus engage with more third-party contractors. It allowed them to 'give their voice' to matters they might observe within the supply chain, such as human rights issues. This widespread approach helps us validate representations from suppliers through their annual attestation of compliance with the Dexus Sustainable Procurement Policy and Supplier Code of Conduct.
column20: Contractor Work Health Safety, sign-in system, third-party contractor

column7: Dexus had eight cases of work-related injuries in 2023.
Dexus had no cases of work-related ill health in 2023.

column6: Average hours of training per year per employee
column7: Dexus' average training hours in 2023 were 17 hours per male employee and 21 hours per female employee.
